body.p: The immune system acts by detecting and attacking anything perceived as “non-self.” The innate immune system responds to molecules derived from tissue damage and to common microbial components. The adaptive immune system responds to specific molecules, and those molecules that provoke an immune response, particularly the production of antibodies, are called antigens.

question.body: In some of the cases in the previous question, immune response will occur swiftly, such as the cases of a bacterial infection or a viral protein. Cases of mismatched blood transfusions or organ transplants will cause rejection. Pollen, on the other hand, may cause severe reactions in sensitive people but not in others. Cancers do occur in many patients. Most males’ sperm cells are not attacked by the immune system and most babies develop without being rejected by their mothers. Which of the following could NOT explain a way that non-self cells molecules can provoke strong immune responses in some cases but not in others?

multiple_choice.choice: Some antigens are stronger than others.
Some individuals have genetically stronger responses than others.
The immune system may be working incorrectly.
The immune system works better in younger people than in older people.
The immune system may not have access to the antigens.

response.feedback: Incorrect. Proteins tend to be more immunogenic (“stronger” when provoking an immune response) than other molecules. Also, the more genetically different a cell is, the more immunogenic it is; that’s why transplants are less riskier with organs from family members.
Incorrect. Some individuals may have immune reactions to certain antigens that other persons do not- typical case of allergies.

Incorrect. The immune system may be depressed/deficient for many reasons, including congenital immune deficiencies, HIV infections, treatments such as radiations or certain drugs, or even stress. On the other hand, sometimes the immune system may work incorrectly, attacking the body’s own tissues, which leads to autoimmune disorders.

Correct. Although there is often a decline of the immune response in older individuals, it is also common for children to have either weaker or exaggerated immune responses due to their immature immune system. Therefore, this does not explain strong responses in some cases but not others.

Incorrect. Certain parts of the body are considered sites of “immune privilege,” such as the placenta containing the fetus, the testicles, and the eye. That explains why sperm cells or the fetus are not attacked by the immune system.

part.hint: The immune system must balance between immunity and tolerance.
There must be direct contact between antigens and immune system for the response to occur.
The immune system learns what is self and non-self during the first years of life.
